Reviews.Title: “Brand New!”
Reviews.Author: Tilt145
Reviews.Content: I am amazed how everything is brand new. I stayed here last year when it was Quality Inn and it was horrible. There are new owners and it looks like most of the renovations are complete. The picture DOES NOT look like the motel. The motel looks better. I had great service and my room was excellent. I guess this place has been a "work in progress" over the last year and it has been paying off. Breakfast was good. Only thing that stood out was a waffle machine. Everything else was the usual for motel breakfasts The actual design of the breakfast room was impressive. Internet signal was above par compared to other motels Ive stayed at. Definitely high speed but I did have trouble figuring out how to enter the password. Location is hard to get to off the freeway the first time but still in a good neighborhood. Overall, I am very impressed. I would stay here again. It looks like they are still working on some of the motel tho

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude, and just a horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Charles6666Brampton
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping didn't even come to my room after I requested them twice. Also, the manager is very impolite and threatened to kick me and my kids out. Lastly, the pictures do not look anything like the real motel.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: dwagnfly
Reviews.Content: Carpet new but ours had stains already. New paint. Furnishings were all new but the decorative trims popped off as they were put on with hot glue. 4 comfy pillows on each double bed. No bugs. A/C worked (individual unit) well but did smell musty, I brought along Fabreze after reading the reviews and it was fine. Hairdryer worked fine. Hot water available everytime and water pressure was good. Could hear neighbors plumbing but that's normal in most hotels. Couldn't hear neighbors otherwise and it was quiet. We stayed 6 nights on lower level. The breakfast room was usually crowded. They could benefit from having two counters instead of one. Could also use more tables. When they were full we just took the food to our room, no problem. They had hard boiled eggs, coffee, milk, o.j., cereals, oatmeal, bagles, muffins, danish, bananas, oranges, belgian waffles (make yourself - good). A Pepsi machine was also available. They kept restocking breakfast during the mornings. Friendly staff. We didn't use the pool. It was small, like one would have at a small house. We never saw anyone using it. Nice residential area. There are a few taco places down the street (El Rodeo is supposed to be good. Vons and CVS only two miles away, Albertson's less than a mile down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, ants .... don't even think of staying here”
Reviews.Author: gabydk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel (2 rooms - for 3 nights) in October 2010, when I was planning my trip to US with my family. Our rooms was away from the street - first we thought this was god - but NO. The back of the hotel was facing 2 highways - and it was so EXTREME noisy that earplugs could not eliminte the noice just a little bit. We did not sleep for 3 nights (the hotel was prepaid, so we could not move). The aircon in one of the rooms was not working at all, so our room was terrible HOT. And both of the rooms (and they were on top floor) had ants!!!! And there was a lot of them - all over. Disgusting - and not nice to have your suitcase open. The hairdryer did not work. I asked the front desk and was told, that I could get one from him. The breakfast room was terrible. We were sitting between sacks of cement and everything was very dusty (from the building materials in the room). The swimmingpool was a joke - size like a hot-tub and not clean. PLEASE - do not stay here. Everywhere else would be better.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay here! Worst hotel stay we ever had!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MeganFC2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at this hotel for 9 nights. When we checked in we were told "if you check out during the stay you still pay for entire stay." We thought that was an odd thing to be told but we were there for vacation and for Comic Con, so we had no intention of checking out before our departing date. Well we now know why that was said! It was because our stay would be a nightmare!! We stayed here last year, when it was Quality Inn, and loved it, that's why we came back, but we will NEVER stay here again!! First thing we encountered was ANTS! Tons of them in our room! Every day there was another huge trail of them all up and around the bathroom door!! We called the manager and he came down with an unmarked spray bottle of unknown chemicals and sprayed the ants twice and then wiped them down with a towel! The third time we complained, he handed the spray bottle to my husband and had us spray them down daily, wiping them down with one of our guest towels!!!! The chemical smell triggered my asthma so I ended up missing two days of the con, due to having to get breathing treatments every 4 hours!! The ants were everywhere after we started spraying! You would open your laptop, on the desk by the door, and ants would be crawling across the screen! You would wake up in bed with ants crawling on the sheets! OMG it was AWFUL!!! So was housekeeping! She would take our towels and washclothes and NOT leave clean ones behind!! We had to start leaving notes on the bed for her to bring us towels and my husband even had to go to the front desk for some as well! The hairdryer blew cold air and the last day that we were there, it died completely!! We told the woman at the front desk ALL of this when we were checking out and she just shrugged her shoulders. Her attitude was the same as his!! I reported it to corporate on the way to the airport the morning we checked out, yes I was that upset! I did not even wait to get home to call! Corporate said the manager had 72 hours to respond. Well this morning I got an e-mail offering me 25% off rack rate on our next visit! HA!! Forget that!! We will NEVER stay there again!! If you are looking for a good hotel to stay at on your next visit, we strongly suggest you pass this one by and find some where else!!

Reviews.Title: “Renovating-Lack of concern of inconvenience to business travelor”
Reviews.Author: ssgLakeside
Reviews.Content: Older furnishings. What was clean was VERY clean. Few things dirty, refrig, hair dryer cord, phone, and interesting - just one wall behind the desk had mildew and also around the door. The rest of the room was very clean. Refrigerator would not work the first night and when I asked the next morning it magically started working, so it may be controlled at the front desk. Ice machine was out of order the entire stay. It appeared that half the hotel was under renovation-rooms empty with no curtains. The problem came after the first night. In the morning I got in the shower around 9:40 am to get ready to go to an appointment and when I was lathered with soap the water was turned off for repairs. I called the front desk and she said it would be 5 minutes. I called 15 minutes later and she said it would be 15 more minutes. I called again after 15 more minutes and she said just 15 minutes longer. I told her I was going to miss an appointment if they didn't turn the water back on. 10 minutes later I called the desk and asked the woman to be realistic and tell me exactly when I could expect the water back on and she said 30 minutes. I told her that I have dried soap all over me and I will have missed my 11:00 appointment. I told her that I needed to check out and go to a hotel that had water. She told me that I should be more concerned about their problems and that I had already paid for the upcoming night (2 nights) and basically it was a done deal. I advised her that my concern was my own travel and appointment agenda that their problems are not my concern. As I was packing up to leave, the water came on. My 11:00 appointment had been missed, but I had time to make a 1:00 appointment so I did not check out. I was too busy to check out and continued with the rest of my business. The second night I was kept awake until about 2:00 a.m with a rapper type music pounding the wall. This hotel is a low budget hotel, good for those on a tight budget, but not good if you have a demanding schedule. Also, do not expect professional conduct from the hotel management and concern for the customer. The correct thing would have been for the hotel to apologize and offer to only charge for the first night if I needed to check out for lack of water-which is what I was only legally responsible for anyway. It is only the first night that I could not cancel, not the second.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: lcordova84
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews here before booking this hotel. It is a nice place to stay if you don't need any frills. We didn't need anything fancy, just a decent place to sleep since we were just driving in for 1 night to see a concert at the Viejas Arena at San Diego State. The hotel doesn't have a good appearance on the outside, but it is in a nice residential area very close to the college. I would reccommend asking for a room that doesn't face the freeway if you're a light sleeper because the noise did bother me, though not my friends. The room was plain, but very clean inside. The beds along with the pillows and linens were very comfortable and clean. It was nice to have a microwave and refrigerator in the room. An added touch was the morning breakfast. They have waffles, cereal, muffins, danishes, fruit, coffee and juice available for a few hours included in your rate. For about $70 (with an AAA discount) it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: ksandfort
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked in to the Quality Inn after checking out of a very disappointing stay at the Inn at Ranch Bernardo. We read some decent reviews and decided to take a chance. The front desk guy, Devon, was absolutely delightful and couldn't have been more gracious. Our room was on the second floor on the East side of the building. It was very quiet and spotlessly clean. It was very basic, but comfortable. There wasn't much around the hotel in terms of restaurants or things to do, but for an expensive night after a long day of driving around, you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Inexpensive motel”
Reviews.Author: GTOGirl1967
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly & helpful, clean room, good price. Night person went out of his way to get us a room close to our car and on the 1st floor. Contintal breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid deal in the San Diego area”
Reviews.Author: USFBowler
Reviews.Content: This Quality Inn was a very good deal at 60 bucks a night in the San Diego area. It was well located, and was nice and clean. The two double beds room was a bit close, but the hotel overall was very good. It was a good deal, comfortable beds and highspeed internet.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sf32640
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying here after the Days Inn up the street had no water. We switche dto the Quality Inn and ended up saving about $200. There were some questionable characters in the area but nothing too scary. I was pleased to find an antique microwave and refrigerator in the room. The AC cooled down great and it was super quiet at ngiht which is always a plus. The look inside the room was very dated but if you can get past aesthetics, it was a descent place to stay. I didn't get to enjoy the pool but I did walk by it and noticed how tiny it was. I also didn't take advantage of the free breakfast but it looked okay. In a nutshell, dated but cheap. I would only stay here again but only because I have friends in the neighborhood. If not I would pay more to stay close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Budget Traveller”
Reviews.Author: bodega1027
Reviews.Content: I, my wife, and my two year old daughter stayed here for three nights in January. Now, I work in a job that requires me to travel alot and stay in a lot of "budget" hotels, from Sonoma County to Ventura (and everywhere in between), so I KNOW first-hand the nightmares budget travelers face, but I'd had better luck with Quality Inn's over, say, Motel 6's, so I thought I'd give this place a shot. When I was doing my homework, I only found a Motel 6 and a couple of non-franchise hotels in the same area for cheaper (and even then no more than $10.00 a night cheaper). While it is indeed dated, this place was DEFINITELY worth the extra ten bucks. The breakfasts were good (do-it-yourself waffle iron, cereals, fruits, toasts, muffins, etc.). The neighborhood was quiet and not at all "shady." Really great freeway access, but honestly a little difficult to get to the FIRST time (and if any of you have older GPS maps, please note that the freeway exit directions may have changed since your last update). You know when you stay in a budget hotel for the first time, and when you get to the door and prepare to open, you begin dreading the smell? Because some budget hotels smell alright, while others give you that face full of funk when you open the door? I was relieved to find our room smelled fresh and clean (actually clean, not air-freshener over crap clean). Service was friendly with only mis-step: I came down for breakfast one morning right after I rolled out of bed, and my hair admittedly looked like a bird's nest (the trench coat probably didn't help either). When I walked in and asked where the breakfast bar was, the receptionist eyed me suspiciously and asked "You ARE a guest hear, right?" Tacky, sure, but somewhat understandable. Otherwise, the service was great for all days I stayed hear. Internet access/speed was adequate and consistent all the way through. Room's were always well cleaned between days. We traveled all over San Diego county from this hotel, and it's central enough to get anywhere in the county easily. It's not a five-star hotel, and it's not trying to be: what it is a clean, friendly, and safe value hotel. I'd recommend to anyone traveling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great budget choice”
Reviews.Author: sarahml
Reviews.Content: Just turned up and booked a room. Great service for the cost. Staff very friendly and rooms very clean. Breakfast served in restaurant/bar next door - very nice! Good selection and staff very helpfull and full of knowledge. Overall a great budget choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice tile”
Reviews.Author: leroydelancer
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and the staff very nice and helpful. Starbucks is a short walk away on harbor blvd and the place has beautiful new windows. The tile has been redone throughout and yes the place is a bit old but on a busy weekend it was nice and clean and set near the midway which was also a easy walk

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Travelers on a Budget!”
Reviews.Author: TinaQ
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a good deal for a clean, safe place to stay in San Diego and Trip Advisor was very helpful. We were driving down from LA to go to Sea World, staying over and hitting the Wild Animal Park the next day. As a family on a budget, the amusement parks were expensive enough, we just needed a basic place to stay that was preferably, not in the ghetto or frequented by drug dealers. Through AAA, I found this Quality Inn, it's about 10 miles from Sea World, a very easy drive east on the 8. The front desk was friendly and efficient, we checked in with no problems. The room was very clean with a big soft king size bed. The room also came with a microwave and a refrigerator which was not expected, but much appreciated. The continental breakfast, besides pastries, juice and coffee also featured cereal and milk which was great for my son. For the $67 AAA rate, it fulfilled all of our basic needs. There was also a small pool that we didn't get to try out. I recommend this motel highly for budget-minded travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal”
Reviews.Author: 94542h
Reviews.Content: I've read some reviews before going there and was aware of garage and tidiness issues. Yes ,it's true re the garage poles but we managed not to touch any with a full size Olds. You can avoid $9 charge by parking your car on the streets surrounding the hotel. My husband and i were really impressed with a friendly staff everywhere in this downtown budget hotel: starting from a quick check in at the front desk to a breakfast room to every cleaning lady on the floor. Yes, the room was smaller than any american average hotel room, but it's clean and well equipped: a coffee maker with two mugs, a fridge,a personal SAFE!!!) An internet-via-TV service is offered for about $10 per day, so you do not need to carry your note book if you go on a vacation trip. If you are on a business trip with your own computer, it's free. We had a desk with a chair in a king-size room, plus an armchair. there are plenty of lamps in the room. The bathroom was small but clean and supplшув with toiletries (soup-shampoo-conditioner-lotion). NO stains on the mattress (i checked!), no bugs, no stains on the carpets or walls/ ceiling. Location is super: walk three blocks down to the famous Gaslamp Distr (5th ave), Horton shopping Plaza (4th Ave), even to Balboa Park up the same 6th Ave. We did not have a harbor view but the skyline was a good enough picture for a short time between coming to a room and falling asleep. The most important feature for me was a really powerfull a/c which was able to cool the room down in no time (it was 95*F outside last week). The Indigo Cafe is very friendly and good for breakfast, brahcn or any time ($7 for an omlette). A block down from it, i found a brand new juice cafe with very healthy drinks. All -in -all, i consider this hotel a good find for a downtown accommodations if you do not want to pay $$$. My only suggestion: please add tea bags to your room coffe package (to avoid a trip to the breakfast room or front desk). Thanks to all at a Quality Inn -Harbor View/ San Diego for a very good service!

Reviews.Title: “Its STILL a DUMP but now they CHEAT”
Reviews.Author: 5genoklahoman
Reviews.Content: We'd planned our vacation for months. With our busy days, all we needed was a room and decent bed. And I have to be honest and say this hotel has those two things. But after that! The bathtub, floor and stool had obviously not been cleaned properly. The room didn't smell but the moldy "swamp cooler" did! (it was an evaporative cooler - not an air conditioner) When we woke the next morning, it was like we were camping out in the morning dew. We knew we were in trouble when we saw the "Help Wanted" sign in the office window. None of the employees seemed to have the power to change, fix, replace anything about anything. I heard the words "I don't care" at least 10 times in the 12 hours we were forced to spend here. Choice Hotels reservations had promised a day-of 6pm cancellation AND a room guarantee. Upon arrival the hotel staff and the 800 reservation agents started blaming me and refused to honor either promise. I'll never believe another word out of Choice Hotels again. We stayed the one night they forced us to pay for - then we left quickly. We wouldn't touch the meager "breakfast" in such a dirty hotel - cellophaned muffins and off-brand Cheerios. The mother and daughter checking out before me were complaining that their credit card had been charged twice. After 10 minutes of arguing, the employee finally agreed to credit them back. How does that happen in the first place?? Adobe Falls Road seemed to be a safe street - busy apartments across the street, houses further up the hill. The location to downtown is ideal. On that same block, I'd recommend the Days Inn that seemed newer and definitely had all the business. Oh - and the wireless Internet does work: we found a 4-star hotel for around $100 and forever swore off "budget hotels".

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Sungold
Reviews.Content: My young niece & I stayed here 3 nights over Easter weekend as part of an 8 day trip to Southern California. I was not familiar with the area, but thanks to good directions that I printed out from Mapquest beforehand, I was able to find it with little trouble. It is right off I-8, but in a residential area that does not have a "freeway entrance" feel. The room itself was small with no frills, but clean. The small fridge & microwave proved very handy. The beds were hard. The small pool area looked very clean & nice, but we did not have the opportunity to use it. We did take advantage of their continental breakfast one morning; packaged muffins & danishes (very fresh), cereal, coffee & fruit juice. One morning we just had some juice & coffee on the run, & grabbed a few danishes to eat later. The staff was very nice, and they had a computer in the lobby for brief use by guests. I did use this the morning we left to check my directions, and appreciated having this service available at no charge. To sum up, I would recommend this motel for families on a budget looking for a clean place to stay in a safe area. It is within easy driving distance of all San Diego atttractions. This was not a fancy or plush place, but not a dump, either. I think it was well worth the money I paid. The hard bed was my only complaint. The motel is next door to a casual Italian restaurant that does a very good amount of business. We ate here for dinner on Good Friday & the food was delicious. Definitely worth checking out!

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Mission Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 5399 Adobe Falls Road, San Diego, CA 92120 (Formerly Quality Inn near Qualcomm Stadium)
